lead_paragraph: Agustín Carstens, governor of the Bank of Mexico, will leave that post next year to become head of the Bank for International Settlements.

headline.print_headline: Mexico’s Central Bank Chief to Lead Bank for International Settlements
headline.main: Mexico’s Central Bank Chief to Take International Post

snippet: Agustín Carstens, governor of the Bank of Mexico, will leave that post next year to become head of the Bank for International Settlements....
abstract: Bank of Mexico governor Agustin Carstens says he will leave central bank in July 2017 to take job at Bank for International Settlements, Switzerland-based financial institution that acts as bank for central banks; impending departure of well-respected economist causes peso value to fall further and heightens worries about country's economic future given anti-trade stance of American Pres-elect Donald Trump.
